page.title: 01Introduction
page.content: This is very much an{Upland Area. The land rises to a high point of{412 {metres}at the{triangulation point}on {Treborough Common}in the South West of the block. Much of the area however is over 200 metres high This upland area is cut through by a very steep sided valley which starts in the South and runs through all the eastern squares of the block. This valley has consdierable interst for{industrial archaeologists}as it carried{the Mineral Line}much used when this part of the{Brendons was an important{mining centre. The wet and very misty weather is now too often a feature of this area.
